instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3481: What is 820-3481? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Got an iMac that thunderbolt is not working. Opened up iMac and discovered a noticeable burn in the thunderbolt IC <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>. The part number is DSL3510L and I have this same IC on a donor <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA L2013. My question is, is it even possible to replace the Thunderbolt IC, or is the firmware paired to the CPU somehow since it uses PCIe lane.

I have attached an image of the burn in the thunderbolt IC.

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Just try, I don't think to be paired.

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Excellent. Replacing the Thunderbolt IC resolved the issue. This one is solved.

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Thanks for feedback.
Is good to have a confirmation, that chip doesn't have a specific board firmware.

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I had the same problem, same solution, I can confirm that it works (I toke also from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>), the burning point was in the same place! Great job [USER=2552]@EsteTron[/USER], thanks for that post!

threads.title: iMac 27" Late 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Awesome! I am happy to hear that this worked for you as well!
